pullrequest.title: Logging bugfix, removed unused import that prevents importing on Python 3 & close branches

content.raw: The logger thing is because I'm making some automated tests for lyse that can involve restarting lyse - but because it all happens in the same process, this function gets called for a second time in the same process, and since the logging module maintains state about which handlers were connected, it was just adding an extra set of handlers and writing log lines twice. This change makes the logging a bit more friendly for now - even though it eventually needs to be replaced since it's not multiprocess safe.
content.html: The logger thing is because I'm making some automated tests for lyse that can involve restarting lyse - but because it all happens in the same process, this function gets called for a second time in the same process, and since the logging module maintains state about which handlers were connected, it was just adding an extra set of handlers and writing log lines twice. This change makes the logging a bit more friendly for now - even though it eventually needs to be replaced since it's not multiprocess safe.
